(2) Brother of Hannibal, left as commandcr-in-chief in Spain, where he was engaged for seven years in conflict with the Scipios‚ Cnaeus and Publius, whom he at last defeated and killed in two battles at twenty-nine days' interval, ac. 211. Hermandica, -ae, f. : a chief town of the Vaccaei taken by Hanni- bal (cap. v.). Perhaps -—- Salamanca.

Hiberus, -i‚ m. (also, Iberus) : the Ebro, one of the largest of the rivers of Spain. It rises amongst the Cantabrian Mountains, in the N. of Spain, and after a course of 340 miles, in a S.E. direction, falls into the Mediterranean. It was fixed as the northern limit of Cartha- ginian power in the treaty with Hasdrubal, 228 B.c. (cap. 2).
